snippet: A new psychiatric evaluation of Anders Behring Breivik, who confessed to killing 77 people in Norway last year, concluded Tuesday that he was not psychotic when he carried out the attacks.
abstract: New psychiatric evaluation of Anders Behring Breivik, who confessed to killing 77 people in Norway in 2012, concludes that he was not psychotic when he carried out the attacks; evaluation contradicts previous report and could give judges grounds to sentence Breivik to prison instead of a psychiatric hospital.
lead_paragraph: A new psychiatric evaluation of Anders Behring Breivik, who confessed to killing 77 people in Norway last year, concluded Tuesday that he was not psychotic when he carried out the attacks.

headline.main: Norway: Mass Killer Found to Be Sane
headline.print_headline: Norway: Mass Killer Found to Be Sane
